Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2009 11:01AM mshalto wrote: Thanks, Barbe---this is just an example of my state of mind but I totally get it. Sorry that you're going through this too. What do you do to distract yourself? I cleaned the house from top to bottom last w/e, and of course work helps (sometimes!) Just getting out of the house helps. I have to admit that anti-anxiety meds REALLY take the edge off ---they make it easier to curb the obsessive thoughts. Thanks for responding!   I should have results early next week. M.
Posts.Title: Sense of Impending Doom mixed with Terror!! mshalto mshalto

Posts.Content: mshalto wrote: Hi all, I've posted about my enlarged groin lymph node saga recently, and now I'm not in a very good place at all. Had a fine needle biopsy yesterday and made the mistake of asking the doctor if she's seen lymph nodes as big as mine, which is 3 cm. She replied that 3 cm was pretty big. Don't ask if you don't wanna know, I guess!  When my onco looked at it on Monday, she said she really couldn't tell if this is a worrisome situation  until the results of the tissue biopsy are back, which won't be until sometime next week. She did ask if I had synptoms suspicious for lymphoma--I had none of 'em. Weight loss? Loss of appetite? Uh--NO WAY! :) My bloodwork is fine but onco said that good bloodwork doesn't necessarily mean a good result. Don't get me wrong--she's a WONDERFUL doctor and I know I'm reading way too much into every nuance of what she says, her facial expressions, tone of voice, etc. Anxiety levels are as high as they were a year ago Sept. when I got my dx. I do feel kind of silly being obsessed with this when so many others here are dealing with very difficult scenarios, but hoping to hear from someone... many thanks- Miriam Dx 9/18/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IB, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Sense of Impending Doom mixed with Terror!! mshalto mshalto

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2009 03:55PM mshalto wrote: Thanks for responding, peeps! Tree--not sure what a blood smear analysis is but they did remove 5  tissue samples from the node. Do you know what caused your nodes to enlarge? Swimangel--No chemo, just lumpectomy/rads, Tamox. and Zoladex. No vascular invasion--a slow-growing Grade 1.   And YES, did myself some retail therapy today--very good idea!  Thank you also, Sige and Barbe. I will post again when I have some (hopefully good) news.
Posts.Title: Sense of Impending Doom mixed with Terror!! mshalto mshalto

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2009 08:11PM mshalto wrote: Well, the preliminary results are negative for lymphoma , but the doctors who did the biopsy told me that often prelim. results differ from final results. Hmmmm...I wonder why? They took 5 samples, so perhaps extra time is needed to study each one? I'm not a doctor--just play one for family and friends! :) I am cautiously encouraged: good bloodwork, no symptoms.... I have been enjoying some excellent red wine from the Chateau Benign region.. Thank you, everyone, for your support and I will keep you posted. Hopefully I'll know within a day or two. Miriam
Posts.Title: Sense of Impending Doom mixed with Terror!! mshalto mshalto

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2009 09:27AM mshalto wrote: Thanks, everyone, for your kind words. Since Friday, I've moved somewhat from shock to a business-like demeanor that helps absorb emotions right now. It's been crazy-- pathology can't identify the primary, but they've said it could be bladder, urethra, anal, G.I., or gyn. It's like frickin' "Where's Waldo"!!   I guess sometimes they never do find the primary and then treat w/ broad spectrum chemo...?? It's off to my very first PET scan. Hopefully I'll hear by tomorrow....how long do you generally have to wait?  Lousy timing with Thanksgiving coming.... Again, thanks for your prayers-- Miriam
Posts.Title: Horrible News re Swollen Groin Node mshalto mshalto

Posts.Content: mshalto wrote: Found out yesterday that the node is cancerous. All the pathologists know right now is that it's aggressive (stage 3 or 4) but they're having trouble determining the primary cancer. They know that it's not bc mets. Certain signs point to the genitourinary area, gastrointestinal, anal..the list goes on.  Having a PET scan Tuesday and then an anoscopy (sp?).  If those don't reveal anything , then CT/MRI.   There's a chance that this could just be what they refer to as CUP (Cancer w/ Unknown Primary). Obviously in shock but more or less functional. With bad news, I tend to go into business mode, i.e., gathering all the info I can from the docs, etc. I guess it's a self-protective device, and it's working for me right now. Emotions will come later....it helps to blunt feelings right now with anti-anxiety meds, which is helping me cope with activities ranging from work, telling my mother and sister, doing laundry without losing too many socks :), and reading way too many silly magazines like People, Us, etc...... It's funny where your mind goes when you're in shock from news like this. For me, it's not been "how long do I have to live", but instead I obsess about making sure I get every anti-nausea med in the book during chemo, as I am deathly afraid of vomiting-aka emetophobic. Well, just wanted to update you guys. Any support would be more than welcome... Thanks, Miriam and her Very Naughty Lymph Node (if I can't joke a bit I'll totally lose it...) Dx 9/18/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IB, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Horrible News re Swollen Groin Node mshalto mshalto

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2009 08:16PM mshalto wrote: ANYBODY???? Spoke to my onc. and she's squeezing me in on Monday. Definitely biopsy, it might be open surgical--not sure yet. I've read that breast cancer doesn't "usually" travel to groin lymph nodes......at this point I don't know what to think, so I will now take a Xanax, my favorite anti-think little helper! Maybe there's a "Swollen Groin Lymph Node.org" discussion board out there in the Internet's alternate universe....:) Thanks, anybody!
Posts.Title: FREAKED OUT--3 cm enlarged groin lymph node mshalto MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: mshalto wrote: Hi, Just back from a u/s for what my surgeon thought was an inguinal hernia. Instead, it's a 3 cm lymph node! I guess the next step is bloodwork to determine if there is underlying infection and then biopsy. I finished treatment (lumpectomy and rads) last December and started Tamox. in January, followed by Zoladex in August. I highly doubt this enlargement is due to meds.....and I feel absolutely fine! No colds, flu, etc... I was really hoping for a hernia. Damn.  Now it's back to worry mode....this time, I have promised myself to stay off the internet (Except for here :)    and I intend to keep that promise. I would really appreciate hearing from others who have had similar groin node issues. 3cm sounds a bit large to me! Thanks, Miriam      Dx 9/18/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IB, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: FREAKED OUT--3 cm enlarged groin lymph node mshalto MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2009 11:30PM mshalto wrote: Thanks for your reassuring responses, SpunkyGirl and SwimAngel: Saw my onc. today and she and the surgeon think that a needle biopsy is a good idea, in order to rule out lymphoma. Based on the ultrasound report, they think it's "probably" nothing major...but  then again, that's what was said about my li'l 1.1 cm breast lump.. Does the fun ever stop? Thank god for Uncle Xanax and Auntie Klonopin--I am grateful for pharmaceutical help while I wait! Will keep you posted- M.
Posts.Title: FREAKED OUT--3 cm enlarged groin lymph node mshalto MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2009 01:56PM mshalto wrote: Yes--had it Thursday, they took 5 samples. I made the mistake of asking them if 3 cm is considered unusually large and they said it was "kind of big". Probably shouldn't have asked! I should know by early next week. I am terrified--trying to keep my mind away from lymphoma scenarios.....
Posts.Title: FREAKED OUT--3 cm enlarged groin lymph node mshalto MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: mshalto wrote: Excuse the flippant title---this is how I deal with surreal stress. They're 90% sure that it's anal cancer. PET scan revealed a 2.5 cm mass next to rectum, plus a 1 cm spot on left side of pelvic wall. Obviously not thrilled by the fact that it's spread there along with the groin lymph node, but I'm relieved to finally have what is a hopefully definitive answer. Seeing a colorectal surgeon for anoscopy/exam sometime next week. Right now, treatment plan includes possibly concurrent rads/chemo, since the cells in biopsy were aggressive. Sounds like Stage IIIb or IV, but what do I know??  I just like to make believe I'm a doctor to amuse my friends, family, and patient husband. :) I'm blessed to be surrounded by the greatest of friends, family, of course aforementioned husband (#1 Good Guy), to be living in Boston w/ access to (hopefully) a top anal doc--ha!     Perhaps I should be professional and say butt-doc. You guys are also the greatest. Enjoy the holiday, and if anyone knows anything about anal cancer, pass it along! Many thanks, Miriam Dx 9/18/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IB, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Me, My Groin Lump, and Farrah Fawcett mshalto awb

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2009 06:10PM mshalto wrote: Thank you Sonia, Leah, and the other women who wished me well--so sorry not to remember your names but I'm just a li'l newbie! I just finished a nice cold bottle of Harpoon beer and I think I hear some strawberry ice-cream calling my name--oh hell---There's gotta be a study out there somewhere linking strawberry ice-cream to reduced recurrence risk. And if there isn't, well, there ought to be. Take care,everyone. Miriam

Thanks alot!
